English: You knock on the convent doors at the crack of dawn, tired from your long journey, with only a backpack and your little lantern.
The doors swing open to reveal the Prioress. "Welcome to Purgatorio. Come on in!" she says, as she grabs your hand, "You're just in time for Liturgy of the Hours. Come quickly, let us begin."
"Performing activities is straightforward. Simply Press and Hold the Prayer button to partake in Spiritual Activities."

Afterwards, the Prioress shows you to your room. "We have Liturgy of the Hours 3 times a day, and we always post the Start Time of the next session above the Convent, so please try to make it as often as you can."

Eltee, the Foreman, visits the Convent. "Ma'am, please come on down to the hospital at ya earliest convenience, we need all the help we can get."

And with that, he walks off.

Arriving at the construction site, you see a small gathering of men and women helping out with all sorts of activities.

"Glad ya made it!" Eltee bellows from behind, "Couple hours and we're done here!"
Feeling the sweat on your brow, you begin to track the Energy you consume, then, rolling up your sleeves, you get to work.

Anna, the nurse, walks over to you. "Thank you so much for your help! But...I must ask another favor of you." "We are in desperate need of medical supplies. You will save a life if you could hurry and get us supplies from the Shop before time runs out!"

Looking at the time, you notice you could make Liturgy of the Hours on your way to the Shop. 

You head out immediately.

"Good, I'm glad you could join us for this." the Prioress says, and for a split second you imagine the slightest crack of a smile on the corner of her lips.

"Your services will always be required by the community, and you will do well to serve them. But, you must also make time for the Lord."

"Keeping this balance between your service to your community, and your prayers to the Lord is the path to Sainthood."

She ushers you into the chapel to begin the Liturgy.
"You better get going," the Prioress says, "The hospital needs you."

"Welcome, welcome! Bwahaha!" a large man standing behind the counter bellows, grinning from ear to ear. "I'm Andre. We don't often get visitors in our little town, so I'm glad you're here. I hope you do stay longer than our last visitor! Bwahaha!"
"Please, have a look at my wares." he continues, "Item pickups and dropoffs take no time at all!" "Anything here is yours...provided you have enough Coin of course! Bwahaha!"
"Feel free to use our chapel to pray anytime you want." Anna continues. "Also, we are open 24 hours, so please come volunteer with us whenever you have a moment."
As you take your leave to catch the next Liturgy of the Hours, Anna stops you for one more thing...
"You seem to have planned out your day perfectly, not bad for a start." the Prioress says as you walk into the chapel.
You feel tired, and decide to take a nap for an hour to regain your strength.
One of the novices wakes you up. "Someone at the door to see you."

Postman Spazz stops by as he usually does, without regard for time.

"You're needed immediately at the hospital, a woman has gone into labor and there seems to be complications with the pregnancy. Please come quickly!"
Thank you for playing the Sainthood Demo!
This demo is a continuous work in progress, so there may be issues, tweaks and changes to the game and its systems.

Your feedback is very important. Please let me know what you think! 

Send me your comments on Discord with the invite link on the Main Menu.
There are over 20 Provisions to experiment with, so try different combinations!
Out in the fields, a woman in a trenchcoat holds a strange vial containing black liquid. As you approach her, you notice a label on her trenchcoat reads: "Christie the Weather-Lady".
"Temperatures are skyrocketing, a heatwave must be incoming." she says, eyes laser focused on the device. "You may get a sunburn traversing the fields during a heatwave."
"If I were you, I would plan ahead and try to stay indoors as much as possible." she concludes, and begins taking notes in her little notebook.
Out in the fields, Christie the Weather-Lady seems to be fiddling with a strange instrument made up of 4 cup-shaped objects, mounted on a vertical shaft, and spinning horizontally.
"It's going to rain today." she mumurs, without looking up. "You could possibly fall sick when traversing the fields during a storm...unless you had an umbrella."
"If you do not have an umbrella, I suggest you wait it out in whatever building you find yourself in." She continues, her eyes never leaving the strange machine.
You look with awe as the instrument works its magic, increasing in velocity as the wind picks up speed.
Out in the snowy fields, Christie the Weather-Lady is tinkering with another of her strange devices.

"I detect a blizzard is on its way." she begins with a worried look on her face. "There's a high chance you could Freeze if you are caught out in the storm. If you do not have a Winter Cloak, please stay indoors."
Postman Spazz stops by with a large duffel bag. "I've got provisions for you ma'am. You get to choose only one though, as we have to share with the community, so pick wisely."
Provisions always appear first thing in the morning. Use these strategically in your spiritual and charitable quest!

Eltee walks up and taps you on the shoulder. "Guess what? We just got approved to finish up the Orphanage! Of course ya know we can't do it without ya, so come on down when ya got a moment to spare us will ya?"
The Town Crier announces: "Good News! The shop will be open for 24 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "I just heard that the shop will be open for the next 24 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "The shopkeeper is in a great mood today, he just informed me that he will keep the shop open for the next 24 hours."
The Town Crier announces: "The shop will be open for 18 hours today!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, heavy rain is predicted today for 6 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, heavy rain predicted today for 12 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, heavy rain predicted for 24 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, heatwave predicted for 6 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, heatwave predicted for 12 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, heatwave predicted for 24 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, a blizzard is predicted for 6 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, a blizzard is predicted for 12 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "Courtesy of Christie the Weather Lady, a blizzard is predicted for 24 hours!"
The Town Crier announces: "We have so many women in labour today, the hospital needs all the help they can get!"
The Town Crier announces: "The shopkeeper is discounting all items in the store today at 15%!"
The Town Crier announces: "The shopkeeper is discounting all items in the store today at 30%!"
The Town Crier announces: "The shopkeeper is discounting all items in the store today at 50%!"
The Town Crier announces: "Today, the shopkeeper is giving out all items for FREE!"
The Town Crier announces: "Unfortunately prices have gone up today. There will be a 10% price increase on all items!"
The Town Crier announces: "Unfortunately prices have gone up today. There will be a 20% price increase on all items!"
The Town Crier announces: "Unfortunately prices have gone up today. There will be a 30% price increase on all items!"
The Town Crier announces: "The Bishop is coming to give a special Mass this evening! I hope you can make it!"
The Town Crier announces: "The Parish Priest will start confessions at 18:30 today, followed by Mass at 19:00. Please be on time!"
The Town Crier announces: "Due to an unfortunate accident, the School will be closed today!"
As the Town Crier makes his announcement, you feel a fever creeping all over your body. Every action you take seems to drain more Energy than usual.
As the Town Crier makes his announcement, you are suddenly filled with a high spiritual energy. Every spiritual action you take seems to gain more Faith Points than usual.
As the Town Crier makes his announcement, you wake up with a gloom feeling of existential dread. It seems at times as if praying has no effect on Faith Points.
The Town Crier announces: "Everyone seems to be in high spirits today! Charitable actions might get you an extra smile or two!"
The Town Crier announces: "Everyone is in a bad mood today, including myself! Don't expect any smiles from anyone!"
The Town Crier announces: "Special event happening at the Orphanage today, please Volunteer and help out if you can!"
The Town Crier announces: "The hospital needs some extra helping hands today, please Volunteer and help out if you can!"
The Town Crier announces: "The Convent Treasury has been robbed! The thieves escaped with a bit of money!"
One of the other novices runs up to you. "We are having a little spiritual retreat and would love for you to join us."
One of the patients catches up to you. "Would you please pray for my boy, he's not feeling so well."
While walking through the town, some women call for you to help them with cooking. "An extra helping hand would be great!".

Winter Jacket
Prevent status ailments during a storm
Enhancements to your satchel allow you to carry more items
Delicious hot cocoa to get you started on your day
Produced using precious gem-stones and infused with sacred relics
Chance to use less Energy when walking
Stainless steel, non-stick pots & pans that make cooking a breeze
A special card that gives you discounts at the shop
Sewn using wool and cashmere fibres for ultimate protection against the most severe blizzards
A Coin donation delivered every morning
Excellent shades to protect your eyes during heatwaves
Swap out your cheap open coil mattress with this latex-based, extra soft mattress that is sure to restore your Energy in spades
This hybrid pillow made from latex, cotton, and wool is so relaxing, it restores your Energy in a shorter time period
Includes a hammer with a smooth grip and a 16 ounce steel hammer head, giving you a powerful swing and making construction quicker
Using reinforced steel during construction ensures the building will be immune to environmental hazards for a few hours
These tents are used by the construction crew for lunch breaks. They will thank you for it
If equipped during building construction, gain extra FP when praying at that building's chapel
If equipped during building construction, gain a permanent Relationship bonus for every activity at that building
Gain a Relationship bonus for volunteering at the Hospital
Gain a Relationship bonus for teaching at the School
Gain a Relationship bonus for volunteering at the Orphanage
Gain a Relationship bonus for cooking at the Kitchen
Gain a Relationship bonus for delivering items at the Shelter
An assistant makes deliveries on your behalf 2.5 hours after purchase
Wear this scapular and pledge to fast from eating today
An extreme form of penance perhaps, but worth it
A thurible charged with burning sticks of red hot charcoal radiates smoke that carries your prayers to heaven
Hire a security man to prevent robbers from stealing from the Treasury
Someone left a package at the Convent doors. You open it to reveal an anonymous donation!
You received a Spiritual Revelation!
Your time in Purgatorio has come to an end. The people gather around you, chanting prayers in a circle as you commit your spirit to the Great Ascension.
Your spirit rises to the heavens, and the Lord welcomes you into the Grand Palace, where the music and dancing never stops, and the joy and laughter never ends.

Your Faith Points dropped to zero.

Your heart fills with a deep sense of dread, it feels like all is lost, and there is no hope.

Your Charity Points dropped to zero.

The townsfolk are angry and have worked themselves into a rage. A violent riot starts, and the town is burned to the ground.
"Thank you so much for the medical items! We really needed this!" Anna says with a smile.
"You are much too kind. Thank you so much for this." Anna says, smiling from ear to ear.
"Oh, you are such a dear. Thank you." Anna says as she collects the items.
"Bless your heart." Anna says, receiving the supplies.
"You have saved a life today, may the Lord never forget you." Anna says with tears in her eyes.
"Ahem!" Gabriel clears his throat, "Thank you for the textbooks, we can distribute more to the kids to study!"
"Ahem!" Gabriel begins, "I really appreciate your efforts with this, thank you."
"Ahem! Thank you, these supplies will go a long way in helping the kids." Gabriel says.

Gabriel meets you at the door.

"Ahem!" he starts, "Thank you, we really could not do this without you."
A teacher helps you bring in the supplies. "Headmaster Gabriel isn't around, but he said to give you his thanks."
"Thank you so much for the train set! The kids will love these!" Emelia says.
"Wonderful!" Emelia begins, "the kids will be ecstatic when they see this one!"
"Is that the Captain Galaxy toy?" Emelia asks with astonishment. "The kids love him! Thank you so much!"
"You got the new Flying Jumbo plane set?" Emelia asks, "How thoughtful of you, thank you."
"Wow, you got the Wonder Lady toy set," Emelia says, trying to keep her voice level. "The girls have been asking for this!"
"Thanks for the food supplies..." Jeff says, eyes half closed. "Glad you didn't mind."
"Great...thank you," Jeff says, "We really needed this."
"Oh good..." Jeff says at a snail's pace, "Thank you for the food."
"Just in time...it's a full house today and lots of mouths to feed...thank you." Jeff says with gratitiude.
"Thank you for the food..." Jeff says with another yawn, "We needed this today."
"Thank you so much for the clothes! A lot of people need these!"
"We don't have much to give, but we hope this little gift will serve as an appreciation of what you are doing for us."
"It's not much, but we would like you to have this."
"As a token of my gratitude, take this."
"Please accept this little gift on our behalf."
"I know its not much, but please have this."
"Here is a little gift for you."
"Please, take this. For your troubles."
"I have a little something for you."
"I would like to give you something small, for your efforts."
"I hope you will accept my little donation."
The mother's screams are replaced with the beautiful sounds of new life: A bouncing baby boy!
With nary a murmur of complaint, the mother welcomes her fifth child!
The delivery is successful, and new life is introduced to the world.
After a few scary complications, the baby is born, and the mother gives a sigh of relief.
It took a few hours in labour, but the baby was delivered successfully, with cheers all around.

Unfortunately, due to pregnancy complications, the baby was lost.

You have no words for the mother.
Your heart fills with dread as the baby gives no sign of life. "We lost it" Anna says, tears in her eyes.
The kids eyes are full of curiosity and wonder as you teach them the mysteries of Theology.
You try to keep the kids awake as you teach them Math concepts.
The kids really enjoyed English class.
Physical Education is always a great time with the kids.
The kids loved reading classical novels in Literature class.
The kids enjoy trying to cook new meals in the Home Economics class.
It's always a pleasure to guide the kids in Music class.
You notice some true gifts of the children in Fine Arts class.
The kids are a bit restless as you try to teach them Languages.
Science is always a pleasure for both you and the kids as they love to experiment and try things out.
An older man walks up to you at the ward. "Thank you so much for all you do here," he says with a smile, tears in his eyes, "it means so much to me and my family."

You spend time comforting an elderly woman on life support. 

"I don't have much time left," the old lady begins, "But the time I have spent with you makes it all worth it."
You always enjoy hearing the tales of the retired soldier of his days in the war.

You spend time caring for a boy who broke his arm.

"Thank you so much for helping my boy," his father says, placing your hands in his. "It means so much to him. Ever since his mother passed, he..."

The man cannot bring himself to finish the words.
"Your work here is very much appreciated," another nurse says, smiling. "We truly could not manage without you."
You help around with the backlog of registration and accounting paperwork, certainly no easy task.
A little girl catches up with you in the hallway. "Thank you for being like a mommy to me." she says, and hands you a little teddy.

The kids are extremely excited after watching Captain Universe with you.

"Getting them into bed tonight might be trouble" Emelia sighs.
One of the boys runs to give you a hug. "Can you stay with us forever? Please?"
"I can't believe our luck." Emelia says, her eyes wide with surprise. "You managed to keep them quiet during study time. What a miracle."
"Thank you for spending time with us," a girl says, her face beaming. "I want to be like you when I grow up!"
One of the other novices runs up to you. "We are just about to start a Bible study session with tea, would you like to join us?"
The Prioress meets up with you. "I know you've been busy of late, but you should spend some quiet time to do some meditation and reflection."
The Prioress catches up with you. "Oh good, just in time for the Eucharistic adoration. Will you be joining us?"

You come across an array of balloons and other decorations lined up in the hallway. "We are setting up for a little social event for our older folks," Anna begins, her face lit up with a warm smile, "We could really use your help!"
Anna meets up with you in the lunchroom. "Sorry to bother you, but we need a lot of help with the laundry. Do you have a moment to spare?"
As you walk in, Anna grabs you by the arm. "We have a very sick patient upstairs, and he's made...quite a mess, if you know what I mean. Could you help us with cleanup?"
One of the little girls runs up to you. "Hi aunty! We were just about to start tea time with our new doll set, please join us! Pretty pleaseeee!"
Emelia speeds past you with her hands full of all kinds of craft supplies. "Sorry, can't chat, arts and crafts with the kids is starting. I could use your help though!"
You find Emelia in the break room, who seems to be out of breath. "Oh don't mind me, I'm just taking a break. It's soccer today and I could use some help refereeing these kids."
"I've got some kids who need extra tutoring for Math," Emelia starts, before you get a chance to greet her, "Would you be so kind?"
Gabriel walks up to you. "Ahem! One of our teachers called in sick today, we are going to need you to fill in their spot for a double period."
Gabriel walks up to you. "Ahem! We have some kids who have been sent to detention for behaving badly. Would you mind running the detention session today?"
Gabriel walks up to you. "Ahem! We have a bunch of extra curricular activities during recess today, can you help organize and run some sessions?"
Gabriel passes by you in the hallway. "Ahem! We just got a shipment of new books, and the library is a mess! Can you help us sort things out?"
The kitchen is the busiest you have ever seen. "We have a huge wedding to cook for!" Jeff begins, with his usual finger kiss. "Let's make the best meals this town will never forget, muah!"
"Looks like there is a surplus at the Shelter," Jeff begins as you walk in, "and they need meals urgently to feed the extras. Help me cook something special for them, muah!"

As you step into the kitchen, you see little lunchboxes spread across tables. "Picnic at the Orphanage," Jeff says, smiling. "One bite of these sandwiches and those kids would come begging for more, muah! Care to help us prepare?"

The kitchen is strangely silent, devoid of staff. "We're back here, miss!" Jeff shouts from behind. As you walk out back, you see everyone's hands deep in soapy water. "It seems we've neglected dishes a bit too long," Jeff continues, "Care to join us?"
"Thanks for stopping by..." Thomas begins with a yawn, his eyes half open. "Need help serving food today if you don't mind..."
"Would love to chat but someone's gone and broken one of the barn doors again," Thomas says, brows furrowed, suppressing a yawn. "Give me a hand will you? If you don't mind..."
"Glad you're here..." Thomas begins, just as you step in. "Just got a new shipment of canned beans and I'm going to need some help stocking the shelves, if you don't mind..."

You notice a long line of people outside the shelter. Making your way through, you find Thomas buried underneath a stack of papers.

"Ah! I was just taking a break." He starts with a huge yawn, "Would you mind helping me with these registration forms? Lots of paperwork to go through..."

"Well, well, well, look who I ran into." a voice says in the distance. It's none other than Eltee.

"Just got approved to finish up the school, and as promised, I'm here to summon ya to help us out. Let's go!"
Eltee meets up with you. "I know I always bug ya in the early hours of the morn, but I find no other time more appropriate."
"Anyway, the shelter is almost ready for completion, please come help us out soon as ya can."

"Ahoy there!" comes a cry from the distance. Eltee once again.

"Now it's time to finish up the Kitchen! You're gonna love this one I tell ya!"
Eltee meets up with you. "Hello ma'am. I hope you had a good week. We're just about ready to put the finishing touches on the Clothing Bank. Will you come help us?"

The crowd cheers as the last nail is hammered in. A petit woman, dressed in a long black dress approaches you.

"Thank you so much for your help. I'm Emelia, the director here at the Orphanage."
She gives you a warm hug. "I hope you visit often, the kids would love to have you around to play with them in the evenings." she says with a cheerful smile.

"Ahem!" a stern voice clears their throat from behind. "I'm Gabriel," he continues, his stern expression matching his voice in perfect unison. "I'm the headmaster at this school, pleasure to make your acquaintance."

He shakes your hand with a firm grasp, and you feel as though it would be crushed if any more pressure were applied to it.

A man walks up to you so slowly that you cannot tell if he is fully concious or sleep walking. "Hi there." he starts with a loud yawn, his eyes half closed. "I'm Thomas Katz...the manager of this here Shelter."

"I'd like to extend my thanks...homelessness is a real issue around here...and this will really aid us in our battle against it."

Construction materials are cleared and stoves are lit up. A man walks up to you, twirling his long moustache.

"Hello there, I'm Jeff the Chef! Muah!" he says with a Chef's Kiss.
"Thank you so much for all your help. I will do my part and make the best dishes ever tasted by the lips in this town, muah!"
"You can now deliver cooked meals to the shelter by bringing groceries here, but you must help with the cooking!"

The crowd erupts in cheers, with singing, dancing and cheerful smiles passed around.

"You did good work rebuilding this town ma'am." Eltee begins, "We'll never forget ya. Well, my work here is done, so I'll be seeing ya." and with that, he strides along into the distance.
You smile quietly to yourself, knowing the little you contributed went a long way.
You open your eyes and find yourself in bed, back at the Convent. The Prioress studies you with an expression that reveals a kind heart beneath her stern look.

"I know you are very enthusiastic about your work," she begins, "But you really cannot afford to burn yourself out. You are no good to anyone while you are incapacitated."

She heads for the door. "Please get some sleep, it will help you recover."

Release the button when the two circles overlap for a CRITICAL HIT. Landing all Critical Hits for an Activity results in various bonuses, so try to get as many Critical Hits as you can!

Stepping through each tile takes 0.5 hrs.

Zoom with the Scroll Wheel on the mouse or Up/Down on the D-pad.

Charitable activites like building construction, delivering items, and volunteering increase your Charity Points (CP).

If your CP falls to zero or below by midnight. It is Game Over.

Side Notifications pop up to always remind you of the next Liturgy of the Hours and all upcoming building deadlines.

Convent activities display their Start Times, while other buildings display their Deadlines.

Purchased items appear in your Inventory.

Purchasing/Delivering items take no time.

Sometimes, money is given to you as a gift when you deliver items or volunteer.

Performing activities in a building increases your Relationship Points (RP), allowing you to perform activities quicker at that building.

Each day ends at midnight. Your goal is to maintain both CP and FP above zero.
Manage your Time and Energy between Charitable and Spiritual activities to attain this goal!
Hover your cursor over any icon to get more information.

When a building is ready to be constructed, the Construct icon will appear above it.

If you have any unconstructed buildings by midnight, you will lose all Charity Points (CP).

Severe weather conditions may cause damage to the structural integrity of a building, leading to its destruction. 

You will lose all Relationship Progress if a building is destroyed, so hurry to their aid!

Stepping outside during a Blizzard will increase the chance of Freezing. If you are frozen, you will be unable to move, and must tap on your avatar repeatedly to break out of the snow. Time and Energy are consumed with each tap.

Occasionally, severe weather conditions such as Heatwaves, Rainfall, and Blizzards will occur. The start time is always indicated with the corresponding weather icon. Stepping outside during a Heatwave exposes you to Ailments which negatively impact your Energy.

Rest at the Convent to remove Ailments.
Provisions always appear first thing in the morning. Use these strategically in your spiritual and charitable quest!

Depleting your Energy (EN) while in the field will cause you to lose all progress and restart the current day.

You are safe if it depletes while in a building. Keep an eye on your Energy!

Every activity performed at a building (except the Convent & Shop) increases Relationship Points (RP) for that building. Higher RP allows you to complete activities at that building quicker, alongside other bonuses.
Your helper is on the way to deliver your item.
Your helper delivered the item successfully!

FAITH POINTS
The Town Crier announces: "There was a robbery attempt at the Treasury last night, but Security managed to contain it. No money was stolen."
"The basement is flooded! Please help or we could lose the building!"
"The foundation is cracked. Please help with repairs or the whole building could collapse!"
"We're in big trouble, the harsh weather has severly damaged the roof and it's about to cave in! Please get up there quickly!"
"The weather damaged our stoves and set the place on fire, please help us or we will lose the building!"
"This unrelenting weather has damaged the internal structure of the building, we're gonna need some major help with fixes!"

Andrew Kim Taegon was the first Korean priest and patron saint of Korean clergy. Kim's father was martyred for practising Christianity, which was highly prohibited in a heavily Confucian Korea.

Kim studied at seminaries at the Portuguese colony of Macau as well as at Lolomboy, Bocaue, Bulacan, Philippines, eventually attaining his ordination as a priest in Shanghai by the French bishop Jean Joseph Jean-Baptiste Ferréol after almost a decade in training.

Kim returned to Korea to preach and evangelize even as many Christians were persecuted. At the age of 25, he was tortured and beheaded near Seoul on the Han River. Pope John Paul II canonized Kim along with 102 other Korean Martyrs on 6 May 1984.

Elizabeth Ann Bayley Seton grew up in the upper class New York society and married a wealthy young man. Tragedy befell her as she lost her father in-law, her husband's business, and finallly, her husband to tuberculosis.

Elizabeth's deep concern for the spiritual welfare of her family and friends eventually led her into the Catholic Church, and she, along with two other young women who helped her in her work, began plans for a Sisterhood, establishing the first free Catholic school in America.

Saint Josephine Margaret Bakhita was born around 1869 in the village of Olgossa in the Darfur region of Sudan. Enjoying a happy childhood, she was soon kidnapped by Arab slave traders and forced to walk barefoot over 600 miles to a slave market in El Obeid.

After spending several years in captivity, where she suffered devastating abuse, she was eventually sold to an Italian Vice Consul, eventually making her way to Italy and joining the Canossian Sisters in Venice where she remained for the rest of her life. She was affectionately known as the "little brown sister", or honorably as the "black mother".

The first Danish king to be canonized, Canute ruled for six short years, succeeding his brother Harald III Hen in 1081. He married Adela, the sister of Count Robert of Flanders and went on to build many churches and monasteries.

In 1085, he set his eyes on the throne of England and devised a plan to invade the country. However, the nobles of the court rebelled against him, forcing him to flee to the isle of Funen where he, his brother Benedict, and seventeen companions were slain by rebels.

He was recognized by the Roman Catholic Church as patron saint of Denmark in 1101.

Saint Elizabeth of Hungary was a princess of the Kingdom of Hungary, Landgravine of Thuringia, Germany. Elizabeth was married at the young age of 14 to Ludwig IV of Thuringia, a German nobleman, with whom she had three beautiful children.

Her happiness was short lived however, as tragedy struck her family during a disease outbreak whick took the life of her husband. Her spirit unbroken, she continued to help the less fortunate, providing food for the poor and building a hospital for the sick.

Vowing never to remarry despite pressure from relatives, Elizabeth eventually joined the Third Order of St. Francis where she devoted the rest of her life to God and charitable labor. She died at 24 years of age and was canonized in 1235.

The first Roman Catholic bishop of Quebec and the father of the Canadian Church, Blessed François-Xavier de Montmorency-Laval was one of the most influential men of his day.

As bishop, Laval's dream was not only to expand the Catholic Church in New France, but also to train and teach its future leaders, opening the Grand Séminaire in 1663 with the goal of training missionary priests. He also took interest in practical education for craftsmen and farmers, founding a school of arts and crafts at Saint-Joachim. 

In his later years, Laval continued to collaborate with the colony's high religious authorities, until his last days. The city of Laval, Quebec, north of Montreal, is named after him.

Saint Frederick of Hallum was born to a poor widow, later becoming a Premonstratensian priest, founder and first abbot of Mariengaarde Abbey in Friesland in the Netherlands.

He was also the parish priest of Hallum, his birthplace, and founder of Bethlehem Abbey for Premonstratensian canonesses.

He died and was buried at Mariengaarde but in 1614, to save his relics from the Calvinists, they were removed and taken to Bonne-Espérance Abbey near Estinnes in Belgium, where they were reinterred in 1616 or 1617. They were transferred to Leffe Abbey near Dinant in 1938.

Saint Anthony of Saint Ann Galvăo, commonly known in Brazil as Frei (Friar) Galvão, was a Brazilian friar of the Franciscan Order, and one of the best-known religious figures in colonial Brazil. 

At age 16, he became a novice at St. Bonaventure Friary in Vila de Macacu, Rio de Janeiro where he was known for his piety, zeal and exemplary virtues. Galvão was a man of great and intense prayer, and mystic phenomena attributed to him include telepathy, premonition and levitation. He was also known for his healing powers.

He was canonized by Pope Benedict XVI on May 11, 2007, becoming the first Brazilian-born saint.

Saint Dulce of the Poor was a Brazilian Franciscan Sister who was the founder of the Obras Sociais Irmã Dulce. Born to an upper-middleclass family, she was deeply affected after a visit to the poor area of the city with her aunt. She then began to care for the homeless and beggars in her neighborhood.

Immediately after graduation at 18, she joined the Missionary Sisters of the Immaculate Conception of the Mother of God, in Sergipe and shortly after founded the "São Francisco's Worker's Union", the first Christian worker's movement in Bahia.

She later founded Obras Sociais Irmã Dulce, one of the most well-known philanthropic organizations in Brazil, and was nominated for a Novel Peace Prize by Queen Silvia of Sweden. She was canonized in 2019, making her the first Brazilian female saint.

Queen Jadwiga, also known as Hedwig, was the first female monarch of Poland, ascending to the throne at age 13. An exceptional ruler, she brought about the unification of Poland and Lithuania through her marriage to Władysław-Jogaila and preserved the peace with the Teutonic Order. 

She opened schools, churches, and hospitals while restoring old ones to their former glory. She attended Mass everyday, and in accordance with her family's tradition, was especially devoted to the Blessed Virgin Mary. 

Jadwiga often prayed before a large black crucifix hanging in the north aisle of Wawel Cathedral. During one of these prayers, the Christ on the cross is said to have spoken to her. Pope John Paul II canonized Jadwiga in Kraków on 8 June 1997.

John Roberts was born in a small village in north Wales into a family descended from Welsh nobility. Initially baptised as an Anglican, he later converted to Catholicism during his travels in Europe, eventually making his profession as a Benedictan missionary in 1600.

During a tumultuos period in England at the height of the Protestant Reformation, there was great hostility towards Catholic priests, and John Roberts was arrested on several occasions during his time there; saying Mass and providing aid for plague victims.

He was eventually tried and found guilty under the Act forbidding priests to minister in England, and was hanged, drawn, and quartered, at the age of thirty-three. On 25 October 1970, Roberts was canonised by Pope Paul VI.

Brochero was born in Argentina as the fourth of ten children to Ignacio Brochero and Petrona Davila. At age 16, he commenced his studies to become a priest at the College Seminary of Our Lady of Loreto, where he met future president Miguel Ángel Juárez Celman.

Brochero founded a home known as the Houses of Exercises in 1875, and later established a school for girls in 1880. He was known to travel long distances in Argentina on the back of a mule dressed in a sombrero and a poncho to serve the needs of the Christian faith throughout his huge parish. 

He cared for the sick during the cholera epidemic of 1867 and contracted leprosy during his travels, which eventually led to blindness and deafness towards the end of his life.

Balikuddembe was enrolled as a catechumen and baptized in 1882, taking the baptismal name of "Joseph". After the Catholic missionaries, for reasons of security, moved to the southern end of Lake Victoria, Balikuddembe became leader of the Christians.

Now Danieri Mwanga II succeeded to the throne as King, and began to crack down on Christian missionaries and converts in his country, executing the British Anglican bishop James Hannington and his companions on October 29, 1885, despite Balikuddembe's pleas.

Mwanga, viewing Balikuddembe's dissaproval as disrepectful, ordered to have him executed. He was beheaded and his body was thrown onto a pile of burning firewood. St. Joseph Mukasa Balikuddembe Parish in Kisoga is named after him.

Kateri was born in the Mohawk village of Ossernenon. She contracted smallpox during an epidemic which scarred her face at a very young age and killed her entire family. She subsequently moved into the care of her uncle who was the chief of a Mohawk clan.

Trouble came when she refused to marry, despite the many attempts by her adoptive parents. She later converted to Catholicism, taking a vow of chastity and pledging to marry only Jesus Christ, a decision that was met with disdain among her adoptive parents and neighbors.

She eventually moved to a Christian native community south of Montreal, where she practiced a very devout lifestyle. She died at the young age of 24. Her name, Kateri, is the Mohawk form of Catherine, which she took from St. Catherine of Siena.

Born in Philadelphia to a prominent and wealthy banker, Katharine Drexel received a solid education from private tutors and traveled throughout the United States and Europe. 

Sometime after receiving spiritual direction from Father James O' Connor, she began her six-month postulancy at the Sisters of Mercy Convent in Pittsburgh in 1889. Shortly after taking her vows, she dedicated her life and fortune to working for the American Indians and African-Americans in the Western United States.

By the time of her death, she had more than 500 Sisters teaching in 63 schools throughout the country and she established 50 missions for Native Americans in 16 different states. She was canonized on October 1, 2000 by Pope John Paul II.

Born around the year 1600 in the Philippines to a Chinese father and a Filipino mother, Lorenzo Ruiz fled the country to Japan after been accused of the murder of a Spaniard.

Unfortunately for him, Japan was ruled by the Tokugawa Shogunate, who were persecuting Christians. Lorenzo and his companions were immediately arrested for being Christians and ordered to recant their faith. On refusal to do so, they were imprisoned for two years.

They were later taken to Nagasaki to be tortured and killed, but Lorenzo and his companions were faithful until the very end. He was canonized at the Vatican on October 18, 1987.

Born in 1611 near Nagasaki, Magdalene was the daughter of a Christian couple who were martyred during the reign of the Tokugawa Shogunate. Magdalene later served as an interpreter for the friars Francis of Jesus Terrero and Vincent of Saint Anthony Simoens and, in 1625, became a tertiary of the Order of Augustinian Recollects.

As the friars were tortured and killed under severe persecution, with many Christians apostatizing, Magdalene turned herself to the authorities, declaring herself a Christian. She was tortured for thirteen days, enduring suffocation, being hung upside down over a pit of offal on a gibbet, and finally, drowning. She died at age 23.

Saint Mariam Thresia, an Indian Syro-Malabar Catholic nun, was the founder of the Congregation of the Holy Family and was best known for her frequent visions and ecstasies, as well as receiving the stigmata.

Throughout much of her life, Thresia received several different spiritual experiences including prophecy, healing, aura of light, frequent ecstasies and levitations. Because of the extreme nature of some diabolical attacks and vexations, Thresia was subjected to several different exorcisms by the Venerable Joseph Vithayathil, under the Bishop's orders.

In 1926, after receiving an injury on her leg which eventually proved to be fatal, St. Mariam Thresia died with her final words being: "Jesus, Mary and Joseph; I give you my heart and my soul."

St. Marguerite D'Youville, born in Quebec, studied under the Ursulines, married Francois D'Youville in 1722, and became a widow in 1730. 

She worked to support herself and her three children, devoting much of her time to the Confraternity of the Holy Family in charitable activities and later founding the Sisters of Charity, the Grey Nuns of Canada.

The Grey Nuns established schools, hospitals and orphanages throughout Canada, the U.S., South America, and Africa and are famous for their work among the Eskimos.

Saint Monica, also known as Monica of Hippo, is the mother of St. Augustine. Born in 331 A.D., Monica was married at a young age to the Roman pagan Patricius and had three children including Augustine. She managed to convert her husband and mother-in-law to Christianity after several years.

Two of her kids entered the religious life, but Augustine cared little for Christianity, so Monica sent him off to Carthage for schooling. To her dismay, Augustine returned a Manichaean, but with great patience, Monica prayed for her son for several years, and with the help of St. Ambrose, Augustine finally converted to the faith.

She was buried at Ostia, and her body was removed during the 6th century to a hidden crypt in the church of Santa Aurea in Osta, near the tomb of St. Aurea of Ostia. The city of Santa Monica in California is named after her.

Moses, an Egyptian government official's slave until his dismissal, was part of a violent gang of robbers until he took shelter with some monks in a colony in the desert of Wadi El Natrun, near Alexandria. 

Moses was so moved by the monks that he gave up his old way of life, became a Christian, was baptized and joined the monastic community at Scetes. He proved to be a prophetic spiritual leader, settling disputes within and outside the community of monks and sometimes carrying a leaking sack of sand on his shoulders to show humility.

After word came of an attack on the monastery by a group of Berbers, Moses ordered the others to leave while staying behind, believing his life had come full circle. He was joined by seven others, and together they were martyred by the bandits around 405 A.D.

Saint Pedro Calungsod, a Filipino Roman Catholic, was a skilled sacristan and teacher of catechism. He accompanied Blessed Diego Luis de San Vitores to the Marianas Islands where many received the sacraments especially that of baptism.

A plot to have him killed began when a criminal named Choco began spreading false rumours that the baptismal water contained poison. Given that some sickly infants who were baptized eventually died, the story stuck and people began to despise the missionaries.

It came to head when the local chief, who now opposed the missionaries because of the rumours, learned of his newborn daughter's baptism. A violent assault followed, and Pedro, along with San Vitores, were killed in the attack. On October 21, 2012, Pope Benedict XVI canonized Calungsod in Saint Peter's Square.

Roque Gonzalez de Santa Cruz was the son of noble Spanish parents, ordained at twenty-three, and joining the Society of Jesus after a decade of preaching to the Indians of Paraguay in remote regions.

Over the next two decades, Father Roque Gonzalez set up multiple "reductions" - settlements of Christian Indians run by the Jesuit missionaries - grappling with hardships and dangers against fierce tribes and with the opposition of the European colonists.

In 1628, Father Roque Gonzalez met his untimely end when a raiding party, led by a powerful "medicine man", attacked the Mission, killing him and setting the chapel on fire. He was canonized in 1988 by Pope John Paul II.

St. Martin de Porres was born in Lima, Peru. Being of mixed race, he experienced a great deal of ridicule as a young boy. The law in Peru at the time prevented Africans and Native Indians to become full members of religious orders, so Martin began as a servant boy at the Dominican Convent of the Rosary.

Martin worked hard and made his way up from church officer to lay brother and finally took his vows as a member of the Third Order of Saint Dominic, granted by the prior who disregarded the racial laws that prohibited his entry. He cared for many people unconditionally, from Spanish nobles to African slaves.

Towards the end of his life, Martin fell very ill with chills, fevers and tremors causing him agonizing pain. He would suffer this illness for almost a year until his eventual death in 1639.

Victor Maurus, a Mauretanian native, was a soldier in the Praetorian guard. A Christian from a very young age, Maurus was sent to the Hippodrome in the presence of the Roman emperor Maximian Herculean to recant his faith.

Refusing to betray his beliefs, Maurus was whipped, imprisoned and, after an almost miraculous escape, imprisoned again. He was then dragged into a nearby elm wood and decapitated around the year 303.

His relics are now part of the Basilica of Sant'Ambrogio, built by Ambrose, fourth-century bishop of Milan.

Your body is overworked
You have come down with a terrible virus
Try to rest or you might get hit with multiple ailments!
Your head pounds with increasing intensity. It might soon reach a fever pitch
You joints are locked in place! Can't...move...
As you turn to leave the ward, Anna calls out to you, beckoning you to follow her.

You both walk past several private rooms filled with all kinds of patients, from the youngest kids to the oldest of the elderly, some confined to their beds, others on their feet with some assistance.

"At last, some privacy." Anna says, as she leads you into an empty room. You are surprised at how much of the commotion from the hallway is silenced in here.

Anna shuts the door behind you, then gestures for you to have a seat.

"Listen," she begins, with a smile on her face. "I know you could be doing a million other things, but you have chosen to spend time to help us here, and I just wanted to let you know that I appreciate you for that."

"Seeing your passion for helping the sick reminds me of why I started. I've wanted to be a nurse for as long as I can remember. Caring for others, providing comfort—it's been my calling. 

"I come from a close-knit family. My parents and my sister, Lily, were always there for me."
She pauses for a moment.
"We had our disagreements, but they were always supportive."

You sense there might be more to the story, but you keep silent.

"Anyway," she continues, "your work here has not gone unnoticed, and I would like to offer you a little reward as a token of my gratitude."

"From now on, I will assign an assistant nurse to you whenever you volunteer here. They will aid you in your duties, which should result in taking less time to complete." Before you can reply, she holds up her hand. "No need to thank me. You have already done so much, and I can't wait to see how much more we can accomplish together!"

Anna opens the door, turns around and smiles at you, then leaves.

You wonder to yourself how your overall strategy will be impacted moving forward now that you can complete hospital tasks at a quicker rate.
